recipe.title: Palak Vada Recipe
recipe.ingredients: 1 and a half Chana Dal (Soaked)1 cup Spinach (Chopped)2-3 Green Chillies (Chopped)1 tbsp Ginger Garlic Paste1 tsp Red Chilli Powder1 tsp Dry Fenugreek Leaves1/2 tsp Dry Mango PowderSalt1 tsp Cumin Seeds
recipe.instructions: Take a grinder, add soaked (soaked at least for 4 hours) chana dal and grind it until a thick paste.2.Then take out the blended paste in a bowl, add fenugreek leaves, cumin seeds, green chillies, ginger garlic paste and other dry ingredients.3.Mix everything well. Add a little amount of water (if required).4.Take small portion out of the batter one by one. Heat oil in a kadhai and deep fry them.5.Pair these winter special vadas with ketchup, mint or tamarind chutney

recipe.title: Paneer Masala Fry Recipe
recipe.ingredients: Ingredients of Paneer Masala Fry7-8 Paneer Cubes1/2 cup Curd1/2 tsp Red Chilli Powder1/2 tsp Black Pepper1/2 tsp Garam Masala1/2 tsp Coriander Powder1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder1 tbsp Ginger-Garlic Paste5-6 Curry Leaves1 Dry Red Chilli
recipe.instructions: 1.Cut the paneer in small cubes.2.Now in a bowl add red chilli powder, pepper, garam masalas, turmeric powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste and mix.3.Now add thick curd and combine it with the masalas. Finally add some lemon drops.4.Throw in the paneer cubes and make sure that all the pieces are coated well. Let it rest for 15 minutes.5.In a pan, heat some oil, add curry leaves, dry red chilli and let it splutter.6.Put in the paneer pieces and cook from both the sides.7.When it turns brown and crispy take it out and serve!

recipe.title: Egg Samosa Recipe
recipe.ingredients: 6 Eggs1 cup Grated Potato3 Chopped Green Chillies1/2 tsp Baking PowderSalt as required4 Finely Chopped Onion1/2 tsp Onion Seeds1 bunch Coriander Leaves300 gram All Purpose Flour2 cups Refined Oil
recipe.instructions: In a bowl mix together maida, baking powder and salt. Add onion seeds and oil. Knead into a smooth dough. Allow it to rest for 1-2 hours.2.Heat oil in a pan and then saute the onions and green chillies until onions turn golden-pink. Add the grated potatoes and carrots. Stir-fry for a minute.3.Add salt, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till the potatoes are soft and mushy.4.Now break the eggs into the pan and cook until the eggs are done. Remove from fire and allow it to cool.5.Make small balls of the dough and roll them into thin and small chapatis.6.Place the egg mixture and shape them into small/medium triangles. Seal the edges with little water.7.Deep fry the prepared samosas in small batches until golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil.8.Serve hot with ketchup, onion rings and the chutney of your choice!

recipe.title: Atthe Mutton Curry Recipe
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 Kg Mutton1/2 cup Ghee1/2 tsp Asafoetida1 tsp Cumin Seeds2-3 Dried red chillies1-2 Bay leaves2-3 Green Cardamom1-2 Black CardamomMedium Cinnamon Stick2 Onions Sliced1 tsp Red Chilli Powder1/2 tsp Haldi5-6 Garlic ClovesMedium Ginger Piece8-10 Black Pepper Corns2-3 Green ChilliesSalt according to taste
recipe.instructions: Use low to medium heat throughout the recipe. In an Iron kadhai, add ghee and hing. Add whole spices and cook for a while. Add mutton pieces and cover and cook for 10 minutes.2.Add sliced onions and stir and keep cooking until the onions are soft.3.Add salt and cover for another 5 minutes. Add haldi and red chilli powder and cook for another 5 minutes.4.Make a paste of garlic, ginger, black peppercorns and green chillies. Add it to the mutton at this point.5.Mix everything well and keep cooking. Keep stirring every 5 minutes to make sure the masala doesnâ€™t stick.6.The mutton will start releasing water, let this water and ghee mix cook together.7.Cover and cook the mutton until soft. Sprinkle some water after every 5 minutes when you stir the mutton.8.Once done, serve hot with fluffy white rice.
